revised_title: Investigation of the Structure and Functions of Wandering Cells in Frogs
tldr: The authors study the structure and functions of wandering cells in frogs, examining their behavior in relation to microorganisms. They identify three types of wandering cells and observe their response to various stimuli, including the injection of anthrax bacilli. The study provides insights into the immune response of frogs and the role of different types of leukocytes in combating infections.
